intro: Hyptis ditassoides, commonly known as the Mexican hyptis, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale blue or violet flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Hyptis ditassoides is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties.
